Name: Kyiv
Description: The capital of Ukraine, an important cultural, political, and economic center, known for its historical landmarks and vibrant arts scene.

Name: Lviv
Description: Located in western Ukraine, Lviv is known for its rich cultural history, beautiful architecture, and vibrant student life.

Name: Odesa
Description: A major port city on the Black Sea, Odesa is known for its beaches, 19th-century architecture, and multicultural atmosphere.

Name: Kharkiv
Description: The second-largest city in Ukraine, known for its industrial base, universities, and architectural landmarks.

Name: Dnipro
Description: An industrial city located along the Dnieper River, Dnipro is known for its steel production and historical significance.

Name: Donetsk
Description: A major city in the eastern part of Ukraine, Donetsk has been historically important for heavy industry and coal mining.

Name: Zaporizhzhia
Description: Known for the Zaporizhzhia hydroelectric station and its history tied to the Cossacks, this city lies on the Dnieper River.

Name: Kryvyi Rih
Description: An important industrial city in southern Ukraine, Kryvyi Rih is known for its iron ore mining and metallurgy.

Name: Mykolaiv
Description: Located on the Black Sea, Mykolaiv is an important shipbuilding city and naval base.

Name: Kherson
Description: A port city on the Black Sea, Kherson is known for its agricultural production, particularly grain and vegetables.

Name: Vinnytsia
Description: Known for its historic architecture and cultural significance, Vinnytsia is located in central Ukraine.

Name: Cherkasy
Description: Located along the Dnieper River, Cherkasy is known for its natural beauty and agricultural landscape.

Name: Chernihiv
Description: One of the oldest cities in Ukraine, Chernihiv is known for its historic churches and architectural landmarks.

Name: Poltava
Description: A historic city located in central Ukraine, Poltava is known for its cultural heritage and role in Ukrainian history.

Name: Sumy
Description: Located near the Russian border, Sumy is known for its educational institutions and agricultural production.

Name: Chernivtsi
Description: A city with a diverse cultural heritage, Chernivtsi is known for its historic architecture and beautiful landscapes.

Name: Rivne
Description: Rivne is located in the western part of Ukraine, known for its green spaces and being a major transport hub.

Name: Ternopil
Description: A city known for its educational institutions and historic architecture, located in the western part of Ukraine.

Name: Khmelnytskyi
Description: Located in central Ukraine, Khmelnytskyi is known for its cultural heritage and economic significance.
